header.welcomeMessage: Welcome to the development log exercise! Here, I will update you all on projects I am working on, ideas for solutions, or just my thoughts blasted out into the universe.
header.checkBackMessage: Feel free to check back regularly for the latest information.

logEntries.author: Jonathan Ramirez
content: I am Jonathan Ramirez, and I am excited to start this Developers Log
This Developers Log will be used as a tool to teach HTML, CSS, Javascript, and json syntax for Cycle 58. I am a Tech Fellow and I look forward to sharing my knowledge with you all.

This log will start off with the following tech stack: HTML, CSS, Javascript, and JSON. The project will evolve into a basic CRUD app Designed for Developers Logs using a SERN stack. I aim to document my own learning journey, share resources, and provide guidance to those who are also navigating the tech landscape. I hope not only to share what I have learned but what others have learned as well.

logEntries.author: Jonathan Ramirez
content: The first couple logs will focus on my initial experiences and challenges faced while transitioning into the tech industry.
I hope to provide insights and tips for others who may be on a similar path.
I come from a colorful background and I have an alternative perspective on problem-solving.

logEntries.author: Jonathan Ramirez
content: Today I learned how to add new entries to my development log using JSON.
This will help me keep track of my progress and share updates more efficiently.
